page.title: 02LOCH HARPORT,CARBOST.
page.content: The River Drynoch,which runs into Loch Harport,can be fished for trout and salmon,when in season and with a permit.At the estuary there are often people picking winkles when the tide is right.They can sell them to a buyer from Portree.One local fisherman farms an oyster bed in the loch.Mackerel are caught from the pier or by boat.The loch provides good shelter for boats and is used by fishing boats and yachts.Sometimes there are windsurfers or canoeists.Coal is also delivered to the coal yard by sea and oil for the distillery is brought by tanker to the pier and pumped up to huge storage tanks through pipes which run all the way up the pier.
